text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus chapensis is an uncommon species of tree in the family Fagaceae and the "ring-cupped oak" sub-genus. It has been found in Vietnam and also in  southern China, in the Province of Yunnan.Quercus chapensis is a tree up to 20 m (66 ft) tall and leaves as much as 20 cm (7.9 in) long.  The acorn is oblate, 10–22 mm (0.39–0.87 in) by 15–27 mm (0.59–1.06 in), glabrous or pilose at base which is flat, apex rounded to slightly depressed; the scar is approximately 15 mm (0.59 in) in diameter.
